metadata.title: CVE-2020-35111 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
When an extension with the proxy permission registered to receive<all_urls>, the proxy.onRequest callback was not triggered for view-sourceURLs. While web content cannot navigate to such URLs, a user opening ViewSource could have inadvertently leaked their IP address. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
